channel.title: birds on the papers
channel.description: Recent content in birds on the papers

item.title: Common Goldeneye
item.description:
Napatree Point | US-RI

On top of the dune while scoping mergansers and eiders, I spotted a single goldeneye. I was a bit unsure of myself, but a few moments later over at the lighthouse I saw a dozen of them together on the water.

item.title: Black Scoter
item.description:
Napatree Point | US-RI

Posted up on the sand dune that marks your ’entrance’ to Napatree Point, I scoped out hundreds of Red-brested Mergansers. Probably one of the most significant times I’ve seen them. I caught a glimpse of a very black duck with a bright orange bill. I was certain what I was looking at. I found it several times after my first spotting, but was unable to capture a photo. Fortunately over at the lighthouse, I was able to see another and get a photo.

item.title: Black-bellied Plover
item.description:
Watch Hill Lighthouse | US-RI

Just as we were leaving the lighthouse, these two birds flew in and landed right next to the shore.

item.title: Purple Sandpiper
item.description:
Watch Hill Lighthouse | US-RI

Three little peeps running around on a rock. Unsure what they were I snapped photos. Sent the video to a friend and she replied ‘Purple???’

Correct.

item.title: Eastern Meadowlark
item.description:
Oxbow Meadows | US-GA

These were a wonderful surprise to see towards the end of our trip to Oxbow Meadows this year. There were a few moving through the field covering the old landfill.

item.title: Long-tailed Tit
item.description:
Orto Botanico di Firenze | IT-52 Royal Botanic Garden | GB-SCT

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on.

I later re-encountered this bird on a trip to the UK to visit my friend, Rachael, where it was heard at Royal Botanic Garden in Edinburgh and several other places. I consider this encounter my first ’life’ encounter.

item.title: European Greenfinch
item.description:
Orto Botanico di Firenze | IT-52 Jupiter Artland | GB-SCT

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on.

I later re-encountered this bird on a trip to the UK to visit my friend, Rachael, where it was heard at Jupiter Artland and several other places. I consider this encounter my first ’life’ encounter.

item.title: Eurasian Blue Tit
item.description:
Orto Botanico di Firenze | IT-52 Lake of Menteith | GB-SCT

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on.

I later re-encountered this bird on a trip to the UK to visit my friend, Rachael, where it was heard at Lake of Menteith and several other places. I consider this encounter my first ’life’ encounter.

item.title: Eurasian Blackbird
item.description:
North Berwick (General) | GB-SCT

My first real memory of hearing this bird is at Jupiter Artland when we first began our hike and I needed coffee. Encountered a handfull of times prior, I’m not sure which to count as my ‘official’ life date.

item.title: Red-tailed Hawk
item.description: Wesleyan University - CFA Lawn | US-CT I saw this bird fly in and land on a light pole from the clerestory windows in the Print Shop at work. I was super excited- this was my first raptor sighting as a birder, and I could see it so clearly although I didn’t have binoculars at the time.

item.title: Blue Jay
item.description:
Wesleyan University - CFA Lawn | US-CT

This is kind-of the bird that started it all. I heard birds calling on campus, quite a lot actually. All different kinds of calls too.

item.title: Brewer's Blackbird
item.description:
Yosemite NP–Valley View | US-CA

This little dude came up to us while we were eating our packed supper after our hike to a waterfall. It was quite angry that we wouldn’t give it any food.

item.title: American Robin
item.description:
Mildred’s Lane | US-PA

My first ’encounter’ was an audio recording at Mildred’s Lane, although I remember in 2020 having a conversation with my roommate

item.title: Common Firecrest
item.description:
Giardino Bardini | IT-52

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on. I’ve yet to experience this bird where I have a strong memory of it.

item.title: Common Wood-Pigeon
item.description:
Giardino Bardini | IT-52

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on. These pigeons were common in gardens we visited.

I later re-encountered this bird on a trip to the UK to visit my friend, Racheal, where it was heard throughout the country, also common for gardens and wildlife areas.

item.title: Eurasian Blackcap
item.description:
Giardino Bardini | IT-52

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on. I’ve yet to experience this bird where I have a strong memory of it.

item.title: Common Swift
item.description:
Orto Botanico di Firenze | IT-52

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on. I vividly remember recording them thinking they sounded like falling glass shards.

item.title: Eurasian Tree Sparrow
item.description:
San Miniato al Monte | IT-52

I encountered this bird during study abroad in Italy. I recorded lots of birdsong for a project on [[tesselates]] I was working on. I’ve yet to experience this bird where I have a strong memory of it.

item.title: Black-billed Magpie
item.description:
Chautauqua Park | US-CO

I encountered this bird on the way down from a hike in the Flat Irons outside of Boulder, CO. I had forgotten about this bird until fall of 2024 when I went through my media of birds. Before becoming a birder, I would often document birds with the intention of figuring out what they were at a later date. Seven years later, I rediscovered the video and the memory crept back into consciousness.

item.title: Canada Goose
item.description:
Jobs Hill Rd, Ellington | US-CT

One of my more notable encounters with this species was when I chased barnacle-goose and by proxy pink-footed-goose and greater-white-fronted-goose . These guys are abundant, and I’m always glad to see them. Another great sighting was at Farmington Meadows when hundreds began flying in from the distance which created these faint black lines in the sky.
